5.12.21  8:14 pm   What time signature is your next song in?

5.12.21  7:41 pm   did you made 'got some money' to revive your old editing stile?

5.12.21  7:32 pm   Ok I want to write RHCP style of music. Any tips for actual writing and not just technique? I know about triads and hammer-ons and whatnot but any tips for applying them to a chord progression?

      have you thought about...... words, ...... concepts, ....... situations ...? Imagine yourself on a leisurely summer outing in california with the boys. that could be a good starting point

5.12.21  7:07 pm   yo
have you ever heard of ohio

      yes

5.12.21  4:15 pm   When I'm in the middle of completing a hard portion of a goal, I often have a strong urge in the middle of hardship or annoyance to run away from the task and do something pleasant. It hits repeatedly, and accompanies a virtual titanium wall that starts to prevent me from moving forward and even if I can stand to get past it I work very slowly. If I cant stand it, I abandon the process. How can I better deal with or eliminate this pernicious feeling?

      i think it's time to have a discussion about it. first, harken back to when the project was first started, and recall what it's really all about, and why you are doing it. this often helps. And the other thing you can do is discuss the specific procedure. If you are hitting a wall, it often means that you don't actually know exactly what you are supposed to do next. sometimes you think you know, but you don't actually know, and this can be a reason for things being slow. discussing things usually helps a lot

5.12.21  4:08 pm   has anyone ever told you your music is bad?

      yes

5.12.21  11:31 am   where will you be in 50 years?

      still on earth MAYBE

5.12.21  11:00 am   how do you find/make all of the cool instruments in your music? i have a hard time finding good instruments to use.

      here's a good trick i use: shorten the release and the attack. most sounds you will find, to start off, are a total mess, with a really long attack and release. probably meant for someone who doesn't really play the keyboard that much and just wants to achieve success by holding down 1 note. But when i shorten up the attack and release, then that very quickly turns it into something that is delightful for me to play, as a keyboard player. Another thing you can do is program in something on one of the wheel controls. my 2 favorite options for this are filter cutoff (wawawawaw), and vibrato. To do a nice vibrato the way i like, set the LFO to somewhere around 4x per second, then make the LFO control the pitch up and down, then, set the wheel to increase the depth of the LFO as you push the wheel up. If you have things on the wheels then i think you're gonna have a lot of fun and be able to express yourself really well

5.12.21  10:36 am   Can we get an estimated time of arrival for the new song?

     i wish

5.12.21  10:17 am   alright, after some intense thought i think i've come up with a way to balance both my creative work and Fun Stuff outside of work, here's my revised weekly schedule:
monday: work
tuesday: work
wednesday: work
thursday: work
friday: WHATEVER THE HELL
saturday: work
sunday: work
is this a fair and balanced schedule or would you recommend i mix it up every once in a while? thanks,

      i think it all depends on how many hours you're doing per day

5.12.21  9:41 am   What is a bad place to write a song?

      every time i try to think of a bad place to write a song, it becomes a great place. the truth is, songs love to come from bad places

5.12.21  8:36 am   How many apostrophes does the next song have?

      just enough

5.12.21  7:59 am   i have adhd and i never have enough motivation to follow through and finish things and i have phases where i will be into something for a while and then get burned out help

      ask yourself if there is anything in particular you want to finish. If you can't think of anything, then ask yourself what seems so special about finishing something despite not even knowing what it would be

5.12.21  7:51 am   Are you considering to make a behind the
scenes video?

      yes

5.12.21  5:40 am   will your next video be mostly in 2d or in 3d?

      all options are on the table

5.12.21  2:14 am   i love your reality videos, do u plan to release more of them,

     yes

      or have u stopped recording them years ago

      no, i've continued constantly from about april 2011 up to the present day

5.12.21  1:04 am   to finish an idea you started a long time ago, how do you put yourself back in the mindset that originally inspired the thing? i have this song idea based on a feeling of profound sadness that i've since gotten over, but now i'm kind of stuck going back to develop it.

      gather more details about the original situation. maybe some things that you would not have even thought of including back then. if you can gather more details from that time, it should help jumpstart the process. you don't necessarily have to 'feel' exactly the same way, but if your brain knows you are pulling actual real details from the time period, then you will be more confident that you are for real in this process

5.12.21  12:32 am   What is the average number of letters per word in the title of your next song?

      3.5

5.11.21  9:49 pm   thoughts on the semicolon?

      it is a clever ploy, to trick people who think they cannot handle the full colon into actually getting more

5.11.21  9:48 pm   is it time for a scarmbled version of your next song's title?

     no

5.11.21  9:36 pm   Can you show us an example of your "not a boat" synth patch?

     i was trying to use that one for years and never found a place for it because it's too ridiculous. i finally used it before the second verse of 'hallelujah', just before the "can't go on" part. it's not the tom sound, it's the sort of gurgling noise behind the toms

     Also curious if you could provide a couple of examples to show the difference between "flute!" and "the good flute"?

5.11.21  9:26 pm   So I think about things all the time but I never write them cause as soon as I start writing them, they feel stupid and meaningless. LIKE HOW DO WRITERS EVEN DO IT, they just sit down and write about meaningless things all day but they make them sound meaningful... and the things become meaningful as a result?

*the rest of this rant was deleted for being too meaningless*


Question: how do you make things that are meaningful without making them feel meaningless?

      there is meaning laced through every fiber of our world. but it has to seemingly be balanced with non-meaning. i've learned it's best not to fight with this natural up and down flow. But if you're wondering how to get this to happen while you are actually equipped with writing tools, my suggestion for that is just gradually start using the writing tools more and more, without worrying about whether anything is 'good' yet. then one day, when you least expect it, the unpredictable flow of meaning will continue as it always does, except the tools will already be comfortable in your hands

5.11.21  9:14 pm   would you ever play a song in your future live show before you release it?

      that would be a really good idea. because songs usually become stronger when they are played at a lot of live shows. so then it would be stronger when you finally record it

5.11.21  12:20 pm   i was in a very bad state mentally for like. the past three years or something, and i felt awful all of the time no matter what, and was in this extreme state of depression and hopelessness. then, suddenly, a few months ago i just started feeling absolutely fantastic for absolutely no reason and have a much more positive outlook on everything in the world. what the hell is up with this

      because no one actually knows what exactly 'good' means, it tends to go up and down, sometimes seemingly unpredictably

I tried playing the piano in music class one time to just try it out and I didn't remember a thing, no muscle memory or anything. Do you know any tips?

      just start spending some more casual time with the instrument
